TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpTransportBindingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement

Docs.summary: Represents the binding element used to specify an HTTP transport for transmitting messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement> class is the starting point for creating a custom binding that implements the HTTP transport protocol. HTTP is the primary transport used for interoperability purposes. This transport is supported by Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) to ensure interoperability with other non-WCF Web services stacks.
The WCF service model uses this class to create factory objects that implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener> interfaces. These factory objects, in turn, create the channels and listeners that transmit SOAP messages using the HTTP protocol.
You configure the factories that this class creates by setting its properties, such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.AuthenticationScheme%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.HostNameComparisonMode%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.MaxBufferSize%2A>.
You can also set properties on the base class, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement>, such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.ManualAddressing%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.MaxReceivedMessageSize%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A>. For a complete list of properties, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement>.
## Examples The following code shows how to imperatively use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement>.
[!code-csharp[S_Imperative#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_imperative/cs/service.cs#1)] [!code-vb[S_Imperative#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_imperative/vb/service.vb#1)]
`HttpTransportBindingElement` can also be used in a configuration file as shown in the following configuration.
```xml <bindings> <customBinding> <binding name="Binding1"> <reliableSession acknowledgementInterval="00:00:00.2000000" enableFlowControl="true" maxTransferWindowSize="32" inactivityTimeout="00:10:00" maxPendingChannels="128" maxRetryCount="8" ordered="true" /> <security mode="None"/> <httpTransport authenticationScheme="Anonymous" bypassProxyOnLocal="false" hostNameComparisonMode="StrongWildcard" proxyAuthenticationScheme="Anonymous" realm="" useDefaultWebProxy="true" /> </binding> </customBinding> </bindings> ```

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowCookies { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowCookies : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the client accepts cookies and propagates them on future requests.
Docs.value: if cookies are allowed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is provided as a convenience for interacting with ASMX Web services that use cookies to make sure that the cookies returned from the server are automatically copied to all future client requests for that service.
## Examples The following example sets this property to indicate that all cookies from the server should be copied to future client requests.
```csharp HttpTransportBindingElement httpBindingElement = new HttpBindingElement(); httpBindingElement.AllowCookies = true; ```

Docs.value: One of the enumeration values of the enumeration that specifies the protocols used for client authentication. The default is .
Docs.exception: The value for the was already set.

Docs.param: members that describe bindings, behaviors, contracts and other information required to create the channel factory.
Docs.summary: Creates a channel factory that can be used to create a channel.
Docs.returns: A channel factory of the specified type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can be used to get a channel factory for sending messages based on the configuration of the transport binding element.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool BypassProxyOnLocal { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BypassProxyOnLocal : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether proxies are ignored for local addresses.
Docs.value: if proxies are ignored for local addresses; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A local address is one that is on the local LAN or intranet.
WCF always ignores the proxy if the service address begins with `http://localhost`. You should use the host name (rather than `localhost`) if you want clients to go through a proxy when talking to services on the same machine.
## Examples The following example sets this property to use when performing requests on the binding.
```csharp HttpTransportBindingElement httpBinding = new HttpTransportBindingElement(); httpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal = true; ```

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool KeepAliveEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.KeepAliveEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to make a persistent connection to a service endpoint.
Docs.value: if the request to the service endpoint should contain a Connection HTTP header with the value ; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set this property to `true` to send a Connection HTTP header with the value `Keep-alive`. A client uses this property to indicate a preference for persistent connections. When this property is `true`, the connection that the client makes to a service endpoint is persistent if the service endpoint supports that.
## Examples The following code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[PoxSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/poxsample/cs/client/httpclient.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxBufferSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxBufferSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the buffer to use. For buffered messages this value is the same as . For streamed messages, this value is the maximum size of the SOAP headers, which must be read in buffered mode.
Docs.value: The maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For streamed messages, if the size of the message headers is greater than this property, then a <xref:System.ServiceModel.QuotaExceededException> is thrown. For a non-streamed message, if the message size is greater than this property, then the message is dropped.
If not specified, this defaults to 65536.
## Examples The following example sets this property to use when performing requests on the binding.
```csharp HttpTransportBindingElement httpBinding = new HttpTransportBindingElement(); httpBinding.MaxBufferSize = 16384; ```

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Scheme As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Scheme { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the URI scheme for the transport.
Docs.value: A object that represents the URI scheme for the transport.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is used to validate bindings against base addresses.
## Examples The following example outputs the scheme of the binding to the console.
```csharp HttpTransportBindingElement httpBinding = new HttpTransportBindingElement(); Console.WriteLine("The scheme of the binding is {0}.",httpBinding.Scheme); ```
The output is: "The scheme of the binding is http."

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::TransferMode TransferMode { System::ServiceModel::TransferMode get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::TransferMode value); };
member this.TransferMode : System.ServiceModel.TransferMode with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the transfer mode.
Docs.value:
One of the following member values of :
- Buffered
- Streamed
- StreamedRequest
- StreamedResponse

remarks.format: ## Remarks Specifying <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.TransferMode%2A> = Streamed implies both `StreamedRequest` and `StreamedResponse`.
